Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Acute Normovolemic Hemodilution in Cardiac Surgery

Participants.evidence: Adult patients (≥18 years) undergoing coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG) and/or valve surgery with CPB from July 2020 to September 2023 were included.

Intervention.evidence: The primary exposure was ANH, defined as any recorded use/volume in the STS database.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates ANH's effectiveness in reducing perioperative transfusion in cardiac surgery with cardiopulmonary bypass (CPB).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was intraoperative or postoperative transfusion of any blood component.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Among 16,795 patients (mean age 65.3 years; 72.1% male), ANH was used in 2463 cases (14.7%).

Number_Analysed.evidence: After propensity score matching (n=2282 pairs), transfusion rates were significantly lower in the ANH group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: ANH was associated with 27% lower odds of any transfusion (odds ratio, 0.73; 95% CI, 0.60-0.89).
